result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha Kay Gregory was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Possess Amphetamine/LSD/Psilocin, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(d).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant shall pay at a minimum rate of $50 per month to the Clerk of Courts office.  The first payment is due by January 31, 2023.
2) If the defendant fails to pay timely, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 
3) The defendant must provide DNA and pay the surcharge; the analysis may be expunged upon application to the Department of Justice. 
4) All payments are ordered to be paid to the BURNETT COUNTY CLERK OF COURT'S OFFICE.  Make checks or money orders payable to "BURNETT COUNTY" and send to: Burnett County Clerk of Court, 7410 Cty. Rd. K,  #115, Siren, WI 54872.    
Payments may be made either in person, by mail, or online either through wicourts.gov or through paygov.us. (subject to each website's processing fees).

1) The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety; no use or possession of any alcohol, illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
2) Defendant is restricted from any establishments whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol- such as bars, taverns, beer tents, and liquor stores.
The defendant shall maintain gainful employment.
The defendant must apply to Pierce County Drug Court and, if accepted, successfully complete the program.

1) The court assessed only the DNA surcharge and waived all other court costs on this count. 
2) All conditions of probation listed under Count 1 apply to Count 5 as well.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Samantha Kay Gregory

defendant.name: Gregory, Samantha Kay
defendant.address: N345 Newman Ave, Spring Valley, WI 54767

records.addlTxt:
2:50 PM Defendant Samantha Kay Gregory in court, in custody.  Attorney Eugene D Harrington in court for Samantha Kay Gregory.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke Esq appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Case is on for Plea Hearing.  Court has now reviewed PLQ, anticipated a felony plea, but PLQ indicates misdemeanor resolution; Court requires basis.  State provides basis for agreement and assured VR compliance.  Atty Harrington provides additional basis.  Def provides information as requested by Court RE: time served, probation, and other cases.  Agreement is recited by Attorney Harrington: def pleading to amended Count 1: misdemeanor theft and Count 5: possession of a controlled substance, DRI remaining, joint recommendation for 2 yrs probation.  Case proceeds to Initial Appearance.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights.  Def enters NG pleas to all misdemeanors.  Atty Rennicke moves to amend Count 1 to misdemeanor theft; Court grants. Court asks def if they understand the agreement.  Def does.  Court reviews Def's constitutional rights.  Def understands that def is waiving those rights by entering into agreement today.  Court asks Def if they understand Court is not bound by agreement, and could order maximum penalties.  Def understands.  Court asks for pleas. Def enters pleas of Guilty.  Court finds def is making pleas knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily.  Court finds a factual basis to accept the pleas.  Court finds defendant guilty of amended Count 1 and Count 5 and orders a JOC.  DA asks Court to accept agreement.  Defense attorney asks Court to accept agreement, argues for 60 days credit.  Def declines to make a statement to the Court.  
Court Orders:
Count 1: misdemeanor theft- 2 yrs probation, 9 months imposed/stayed $443 costs
Count 5: possession of amphetamine/cocaine/psilocybin- 2 yrs probation, 1 yr imposed/stayed (jail on counts 1 and 5 concurrent) $200 costs
Conditions: Must apply to Pierce County Drug Court and successfully complete.  The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription. Defendant is restricted from any establishments whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol- such as bars, taverns, beer tents, and liquor stores. The defendant shall maintain gainful employment.  $50/month to the Clerk of Courts Office, 3 months before payments begin (1st payment by end of January 2023).  If def fails to pay timely, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. 60 days jail credit, parties have 7 days to confirm or amend it.  
Appeal rights provided.  DNA to be provided to the Sheriff before leaving the building.

ADDRESS INFO for Samantha Kay Gregory
Current: N345 Newman Ave, Spring Valley, WI 54767 United States  (Effective: 05-10-2022)
Prior: 26597 Old 35, Webster, WI 54893
Plea hearing on October 27, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Defendant must post $2,000 cash to be released from custody; all previously posted cash has been forfeited.  No contact with the victim or their residence. The defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.  No use or possession of any illegal drugs, paraphernalia, or controlled substances without a valid prescription.  Subject to random testing of breath, blood or urine by any law enforcement or corrections officer upon arrest or reasonable suspicion.
Only judge may quash this warrant unless the cash bond is posted in full.

02:34 PM Attorney Eugene D Harrington in court.  Kevin Thomas Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Def fails to appear by any means.  Court makes record regarding prior appearance/notice.  State requests a warrant.  Atty Harrington stands mute.  Court issues warrant, $2000 cash, only judge may quash.  Court orders the cash bond forfeited the cash.  If def appears within 30 days, the court will have discretion as it relates to the bail/bond forfeiture.

Def has contacted PD's office, was told that she qualifies, but has not had one appointed as of yet.  Court to adjourn the initial appearance for def to have counsel appointed.  Bond continues.  Initial appearance scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
